accussed_details.name: Shoukat Hussain
allegation: Obtained land from Barrage Department on basis of hardship
Eligibility questioned due to student status

complaint_summary: Petitioner alleged that respondent was ineligible for land grant due to student status and family receiving multiple lots.
investigation_summary: Petitioner presented Sind University certificate, Khasra Girdawari, and Revenue Rulings to support claims. Respondent provided electoral list, ID card, and Khasra Girdawari to prove eligibility.
judgment_summary: Court ruled respondent eligible for land grant as a separate family member and private student. Petition rejected due to lack of merit and time-barred appeal.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued respondent's student status disqualified him under Land Grant Policy.
Respondent argued private student status and separate family living made him eligible.
key_issues: Eligibility of private student for land grant
Family receiving multiple lots of land
summary_vector_notes: Petition rejected due to respondent's eligibility under Land Grant Policy as a separate family member and private student. Appeal time-barred.

key_points.appellant_argument: Respondent was a student at the time of land grant and ineligible.
Respondent's family received 3 lots of land and father is a Zamindar.

key_points.respondent_argument: Respondent was 25 years old, living separately, and eligible as a separate family member.
Private students can cultivate land and continue studies.
supporting_documents: Sind University certificate showing respondent completed B.A.

court_findings: Respondent was a private student and eligible for land grant.
Respondent was living separately from father and qualified as a separate family member.
Land was granted in open Katchery without contest from petitioner.
